<title level="1" right="Rules">[Fly Speed](/Rules.aspx?ID=2350)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 420 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
As long as you have a fly Speed, you can use the [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) and [Arrest a Fall](/Actions.aspx?ID=2308) actions. You can also attempt to [Maneuver in Flight](/Actions.aspx?ID=2371) if you're trained in the [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) skill.

Wind conditions can affect how you use the Fly action. In general, moving against the wind uses the same rules as moving through [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=2366) (or greater difficult terrain, if you're also flying upward), and moving with the wind allows you to move 10 feet for every 5 feet of movement you spend (not cumulative with moving straight downward). For more information on spending movement, see [Tactical Movement](/Rules.aspx?ID=2355).

Upward and downward movement are both relative to the gravity in your area; if you're in zero gravity, moving up or down is no different from moving horizontally.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
